responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Regex Injection via User-Agent string in UAParser.js
    analysis: |
      The `UAParser.js` library allows extending its regular expression maps via user-provided input. If an attacker can control the User-Agent string used as input to the library, they can craft a malicious regular expression that leads to ReDoS (Regular Expression Denial of Service).  This can happen if the application using UAParser.js allows users to set arbitrary User-Agent headers or uses untrusted input as part of the User-Agent string.
    cwe: CWE-1333
    function_names:
      - UAParser
    filenames:
      - src/ua-parser.js
    classification: slightly promising
```

leads.headline: Regex Injection via User-Agent string in UAParser.js
leads.analysis: The UAParser.js library allows extending its regular expression maps via user-provided input. If an attacker can control the User-Agent string used as input to the library, they can craft a malicious regular expression that leads to ReDoS (Regular Expression Denial of Service).  This can happen if the application using UAParser.js allows users to set arbitrary User-Agent headers or uses untrusted input as part of the User-Agent string.
